choices.C: less than or equal to 60 ms jitter
choices.D: less than or equal to 300 ms of one-way latency
choices.B: less than or equal to 10 percent packet loss
choices.A: less than or equal to 150 ms of one-way latency

discussion.content:
A. Less than or equal to 150 ms of one-way latency
C. Less than or equal to 60 ms jitter
???

questions.question_text: What are the QoS requirements for voice and video calls over a Cisco MPLS VPN?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
The circumflex (^) character, used with the square brackets, negates a range of values. In this scenario "13[^3-9]6" would match with “1306, 1316, 1326, 13*6, 13#6” while it'd negate “1336, 1346, 1356, 1366, 1376, 1386, 1396"

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Which route pattern can the Cisco UCM administrator apply to the configuration to allow calls to “1306, 1316, 1326, 13*6, 13#6” only?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
once again poorly worded question, but answer is obviously B

Selected Answer: B
B is correct.
Just putting in a voting comment so it shows on the solution.

Answer is B - SIP Trunk

https://community.cisco.com/t5/ip-telephony-and-phones/2-part-question-regarding-dns-on-cucm/td-p/2256179

Unified CM can use DNS to:
•Provide simplified system management
•Resolve fully qualified domain names to IP addresses for trunk destinations
•Resolve fully qualified domain names to IP addresses for SIP route patterns based on domain name

questions.question_text: Which entity does Cisco UCM use DNS to resolve fully qualified domain names to an IP address?

choices.A: It provides content sharing to remote devices.
choices.D: It provides presence information to remote devices.
choices.B: It encrypts a Mobile and Remote Access connection over a public network.
choices.C: It provides provisioning services to remote devices.

questions.question_text: What is the purpose of the HTTPS protocol when using Mobile and Remote Access registrations?

discussion.content:
The correct answer to the question about the purpose of the HTTPS protocol in Mobile and Remote Access (MRA) registrations is:

C. It provides provisioning services to remote devices.

The HTTPS reverse proxy, running on the Cisco Expressway Edge server, is responsible for providing secure data services such as provisioning, visual voicemail, and other necessary functions for remote devices.

Selected Answer: C
Agree, it is C:
HTTPS: Logon, provisioning, configuration, directory, Visual Voicemail

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/voice_ip_comm/expressway/config_guide/X14-3/mra/exwy_b_mra-deployment-guide-x143/exwy_m_mra-overview-and-planning.html

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer must configure Cisco UCM to sync with an LDAP server. After the LDAP configuration is complete, the authentication times out before Cisco UCM logs in. Which port must be open on the firewall to resolve the issue?

discussion.content:
The last setting that should be set up for an LDAP synchronization is the LDAP server
address and port 389. When pointing to a Microsoft global catalog, use port 3268 instead.
636 Secure port

Selected Answer: D
Agree, it is D:

3389: RDP (secure LDAP: 3269)
123: NTP
161: SNMP
389: LDAP (not secure)
If the default option of 389 is used, then communications between the CUCM and the LDAP server will be in clear form.
